titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) personal papers, Audiovisual materials, Series R
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller personal papers, Audiovisual materials, Series R FA755

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-12-01 05:07:47 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller personal papers, Audiovisual materials, Series R

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research. When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center recognizes that our audiovisual materials may contain problematic language and/or content.

The films, videos, and/or sound in this collection have not been altered in any way. All titles and/or content are illustrative of the creator's original vision. As such, this audiovisual collection may contain discriminatory visual and/or aural content that is representative of racial, gendered, or ableist biases.

Accompanying description, most often with creator or donor-generated language and terminology, has to this point been retained and maintained "as received" by RAC with minimal archivist intervention or augmentation.
We acknowledge these problems and aim to cultivate inclusive representation and equity by reconsidering and enhancing our description of this audiovisual material with current sensibilities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A group of amateur and professional films, television episodes, etc., belonging to or featuring NAR.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: NBC documentary on wealthy figures and their various collections, including interview with Nelson Rockefeller in the Executive Mansion in Albany. Nelson Rockefeller appears in final portion of the program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film of Apollo VIII mission, narrated by Art Fleming, which was shown at a New York State dinner for the Apollo VIII astronauts and their wives (1969 January 10).

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller: Dartmouth Reunion I

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1935 footage from Class of 1930 reunion in Hanover VT: classmates join baseball game on campus, marching band, picnic on the Haffenraffer Estate, etc.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller: Dartmouth Reunion II

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hanover, VT: Senior class officers, Alpha Delta Phi fraternity baseball game, Beth Theta Pi group in front of house, Psi Upsilon baseball game, Sigma Alpha Epsilon play cards; views of Dartmouth campus; hazing scene with men dressed liked babies in competition for "cutest baby".

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller Dartmouth Reunion III

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hanover, VT: group shots of classmates with wives, classic car scenes, swimming and baseball.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller Family Film II

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1940s footage of Nelson Rockefeller family on vacations: Yellowstone Park WY at Old Faithful, at Jackson Lake Lodge, riding horses; playing at Seal Harbor, twins on the beach; Pocantico Hills-Hawes House, visiting with JDR JR and Abby, sailing boats.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1950 footage of the family playing at Pocantico Hills with John D. Rockefeller Jr.: playing in pool, eating on patio; additional footage from the graduation of Steven Rockefeller from Princeton University.

did.physdesc: Silent, Color and Black and white, 11 minutes

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1930s and 1940s travel footage from Asia and the western United States. Nelson A. Rockefeller and Mary Toddhunter Clark Rockefeller in the Far East. Footage includes scenes of Chinese boat and rice paddies. Footage of Pocantico Hills with scenes of Mary Toddhunter Clark Rockefeller playing with the children in the garden, miscellenous footage of the western United States, and scenes of Mary Toddhunter Clark Rockefeller and children playing in Seal Harbor at the beach.

accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York City NY: interview about history of the International Basic Economy Corporation (IBEC).
